I'm thinking some form of ablative heatshield panneling for space shuttle wings and fuselages and... Well... Yeah. This might be difficult due to how the colliders of wings in ksp are'nt identical to the graphical model, so you would have these panels floating slightly below the wing or hidden inside it ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) Still, you could probably use the offset tool for that. 

You would have to have different shapes any curvatures to fit fuselages and wing edges. Not sure how it would work for cockpit fronts though.

Anyway, you see my point. I would make this myself, but after reading through some modelling and texuring tutorials, I thought i'd just post a request instead ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I think i'll get working on that.
